MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant. Here are exceptions to this rule: 1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted. 2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of init_response_body_data: ```c static int init_response_body_data (void) { if (0 != body_dyn_size) { body_dyn = (char *) malloc (body_dyn_size); if (NULL == body_dyn) { fprintf (stderr, "Failed to allocate memory.\n"); return 0; } if (tool_params.medium) { /* Fill the body with HTML-like content */ size_t pos; size_t filler_pos; static const char body_header[] = "\n" "\nSample page title\n\n" "\n"; static const char body_filler[] = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
\n"; static const char body_footer[] = "\n" "\n"; pos = 0; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_header, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header)); pos += MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header); for (filler_pos = 0; filler_pos < (body_dyn_size - (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header) + MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer))); ++filler_pos) { body_dyn[pos + filler_pos] = body_filler[filler_pos % MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_filler)]; } pos += filler_pos; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_footer, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer)); } else { /* Fill the body with binary-like content */ size_t pos; for (pos = 0; pos < body_dyn_size; ++pos) { body_dyn[pos] = (char) (unsigned char) (255U - pos % 256U); } } } return ! 0; } ``` Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c for (filler_pos = 0; filler_pos < (body_dyn_size - (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header) + MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer))); ++filler_pos) ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
scenario: The controlling expression is not invariant: it depends on the loop variable filler_pos which is incremented each iteration. Although the right-hand bound uses body_dyn_size and constant lengths, the comparison filler_pos < (...) changes as filler_pos changes, so Rule 14.3 is not violated. (Note: unrelated safety concern — if body_dyn_size is smaller than the sum of the static lengths the subtraction on size_t may underflow; that should be checked, but it does not make the controlling expression invariant.)
